quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fire and Day
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, wisconsin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1871 what major Midwest city burned down in a fire that was deemed one of the largest disasters in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: A fire killed over 1600 people in 1845 in what Chinese city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guangzhou (Canton)

questions.question: On average, how much water is used in the USA each day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 340 Billion Gallons

questions.question: The Don Paz passenger ferry was on its way to what island in 1987 when it collided with an oil tanker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philippines

questions.question: Where  would  you  find The Book of Kells?

options.text: Next to the Book of Durrow

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Next to the Book of Durrow

questions.question: From which book is this quote: When Gregor Samsa awoke he was transformed into an incredibly large, disgusting vermin.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kafkas The Metamorphosis

questions.question: Which famous novel begins with the sentence: Whether I shall turn out to be the hero of my own life, or whether that station will be held by anybody else, these pages must show.?

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Copperfield

questions.question: The Peshtigo Fire (in Wisconsin and Michigan) occurred on the same day as the Great Chicago Fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: General Slocum was the name of a person involved in the 1904 fire in New York that resulted in over 1000 deaths.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year did the Great Fire of London occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1666

questions.question: The Los Angeles Earthquake of 1916 caused a 3-day fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which plane is the first  jet fighter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heinkel He 280

questions.question: There was a fire in South Dakota that destroyed over 90,000 acres.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What Oklahoma city saw a race riot that triggered a fire in 1921?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tulsa

questions.question: What U.S. National Park saw a large and very destructive fire in 1988?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellowstone

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Statement and Period
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, crimes, spellman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these weapons is a US Marine infantry  weapon, scheduled for widespread use in starting 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: SMAW-NE

questions.question: Who was the first female professor at Princeton University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannah Arendt

questions.question: Narcissistic is a word that applies to someone who has a pervasive pattern of cruel, demeaning, and aggressive behavior, beginning in early adulthood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: If a red house is made out of red bricks, a black house is made out of black bricks, and a white house is made out of white bricks, what is a greenhouse made out of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: glass

questions.question: In 1964 Francis Cardinal Spellman banned all Catholic children in the New York Archdiocese from doing this.

options.text: Listening to transistor radios in school

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doing the Twist

questions.question: Canada  is made up of 10 Provinces. How many of them do not border the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Which of these words means biting, sarcastic, acid-mouthed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mordant

questions.question: Which statement is correct?

options.text: Graceland, Elvis Presleys home, is the most visited home in the USA.
In Latin Io sperrio discum means While I breathe, I learn.
The Italian government added the expression orbium phonographicorum theca as the  definition for the new Latin word discotheque.
Disko Island is located off the west coast of Greenland.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Disko Island is located off the west coast of Greenland.

questions.question: What does a vexillogist study and/or collect  ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flags

questions.question: Which statement is untrue about the Human Papiloma Virus(HPV)?

options.text: The HPV can cause cancer of the penis.
There is no complete cure for disease caused by the HPV.
About 75% of the strains of the HPV cause cervical cancer.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 75% of the strains of the HPV cause cervical cancer.

questions.question: Who was the first person to  use the term atomic bomb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.G. Wells

questions.question: The Predator is a type of US Air Force plane. How many people can ride in it ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: What do historians call the period of 1730-1759 in American history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Awakening

questions.question: We all know that when arrested you must be Mirandized. Of what crime or crimes was Mr. Miranda accused?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rape and kidnapping

questions.question: On March 19 2008 President Bushs approval rates  were 31% and 69%. What were his chances of winning the 2008 presidential race?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0%

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lawyer and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, rumpole. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Rumpole from the fabulous British TV series Rumpole of the Bailey likes his job defending people in court and does not want to be a judge. What is Rumpoles first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horace

questions.question: Atticus Finch was a great, moral man and a fine lawyer who defended Tom Robinson. In which novel and  movie was he a central character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To Kill a Mockingbird

questions.question: A man walks up to you and says Everything I say is a lie. Is he telling the truth or lying?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is lying.

questions.question: A farmer and his son are working together. The farmer is carrying one sack of grain and the son is carrying two sacks. Who was carrying the heavier load- the son or the father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the father

questions.question: Four can be half of five.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the 1992 movie, My Cousin Vinnie, Ralph Macchio asks his cousin Vinnie to be his lawyer. What was  Vinnies last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gambini

questions.question: The actor who starred as the lawyer in Matlock started out as a real lawyer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of the hospital lawyer on Scrubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Buckland

questions.question: Who portrayed Adam Schiff, the Manhattan District Attorney in Law and Order?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Hill

questions.question: A man shoots his wife. Then he holds her underwater for 5-10 minutes. Then he hangs her. 30 minutes later they go out to dinner at a 5-star restaurant. How is this possible?

options.text: He brings her back to life.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is a photographer

questions.question: Who was the top prosecutor, before Jack McCoy got the first chair in the top cases on Law and Order?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Stone

questions.question: WETYIAFHKLXVNM
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: top

questions.question: He was the young, honest lawyer who won the case in the movie and novel The Rainmaker.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudy Baylor

questions.question: What was the name of the sleazy lawyer in the musical and movie Chicago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Flynn

questions.question: A woman has 7 children. Half of them are boys. Can this be true?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Law and Legend
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, seinfeld, lawyers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This lawyers unspoken last thought is, It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to, than I have ever known.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sydney Carton

questions.question: In Will and Grace, Will was a fine lawyer. What was his last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Truman

questions.question: This lawyer-turned senator, who has the power of flight without machinery, is a character on Heroes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nathan Petrelli

questions.question: Perry Mason won his cases. Week after week this D.A. lost to Perry on the TV show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamilton Burger

questions.question: How is the white woman appearing at the Belchen Tunnel in Switzerland described according to the urban legend?

options.text: Headless woman wearing a white dress

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old woman in white clothes

questions.question: What was the name of the first Assistant District Attorney on Law and Order?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Robinette

questions.question: What is the favorite victim of The Hook according to the popular urban legend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A young couple

questions.question: Where does the ghost of Bloody Mary appear when summoned according to a popular urban legend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the mirror

questions.question: What is the Choking Doberman from the popular urban legend choking on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human fingers

questions.question: From which law school did fictional character Elle Woods graduate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard

questions.question: The vanishing hitchhiker is an urban legend about people who suddenly disappear after they have been offered a lift. What kind of person was the vanishing hitchhiker from 1975 who reportedly scared a number of people by vanishing from their vehicles close to the Austrian-German border?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A nun

questions.question: In what type of outfit was Resurrection Mary buried according to the popular urban legend from the region of Chicago, Illinois?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White dancing dress

questions.question: Goren solves every case, but this is the name of the A.D.A. who convicts the perps on Law and Order: Criminal Intent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Carver

questions.question: He was the luckless lawyer for Cosmo Kramer in Seinfeld.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackie Chiles

questions.question: On this TV show the lawyers shingle reads Attorney-at-Law, Ernest Frye - Where Winning Is Everything.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amen

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Charley and Earth
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, discovery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was written on the girls bathroom mirror according to the popular urban legend about the The Licked Hand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humans can lick too

questions.question: In 1987 he became the first football coach to have Gatorade splashed on his head.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Parcells

questions.question: In the original version of Layla by Derek and the Dominoes, the guitar riffs were played by these two men.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Clapton and Duane Allman

questions.question: Who is the mysterious murderer from the urban legend known as The Babysitter and the Man Upstairs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A madman

questions.question: Which of the following was not a result of the War of the Roses?

options.text: The end of the feudal powers of British nobles
Henry VII took power in England.
The defeat of the Spanish Armada
A strong central government in England

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The defeat of the Spanish Armada

questions.question: Who wrote The Murders in the Rue Morgue, the book considered the first detective story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allan Poe

questions.question: Who tries to warn the driver of the car about the killer in the back seat according to the popular urban legend?

options.text: A wolf appearing on the road
A driver of the car behind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A driver of the car behind

questions.question: Where was the  first museum in the USA located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charleston, S.C.

questions.question: In 1962 John Steinbeck published Travels with Charley: In Search of America. Who was Charley?

options.text: Steinbecks son from his marriage to Edith Wharton

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steinbecks pet poodle

questions.question: Although the first paperback books were published in Germany, it was in England that the paperback book first became very popular. This is considered the first paperback novel.

options.text: A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens
The Adventures of Tom Thumb by Brigham Wise-Dunne

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pelham by Edward Bulwer-Lytton

questions.question: What part of the Earths water is fresh water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: less than 5%

questions.question: Where would you find the highest tides on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bay of Fundy

questions.question: Where does about 90 % of volcanic activity on Earth occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Under the oceans

questions.question: With what American city is the urban legend about the Sewer alligator mostly associated with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: What discovery did Dr. Caspar Wistar make near his house in Gloucester County, New Jersey in 1787?

options.text: The first dinosaur bones ever found in the USA.
A note containing a plot by France to conquer the newly formed USA.
The correct formula for methane gas.
The use of ether to anesthetize dental patients.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first dinosaur bones ever found in the USA.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Steven Spielberg and Kind
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What kind of dead life form does E.T. revive in the 1982 science fiction movie E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial directed by Steven Spielberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A dead flower

questions.question: He was the first person to portray James Bond in a visual medium, thus eliminating actors who voiced James Bond on radio.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Nelson

questions.question: Where was the worlds first modern electrically air-conditioned building located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Antonio, Texas

questions.question: What did H. Taylor Howard invent in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Satellite dish

questions.question: What kind of shark is the scary man-eating monster in the 1975 horror movie Jaws directed by Steven Spielberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great white shark

questions.question: What American actor portrayed Private First Class James Francis Ryan in Steven Spielbergs 1998 movie masterpiece Saving Private Ryan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matt Damon

questions.question: The worlds oldest lake is also the worlds deepest lake. Where would it be found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Siberia

questions.question: Which of the following Steven Spielberg movies broke box office records at its release becoming the highest-grossing movie at the time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the name of Oprah Winfreys character in the 1985 drama movie The Color Purple directed by Steven Spielberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sofia

questions.question: What is the color of the little girls coat that catches the eye of Oskar Schindler in Steven Spielbergs 1993 movie Schindlers List?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: What does querulous mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Always complaining

questions.question: What kind of animal is seen in the dumbwaiter in one of the funniest scenes from the 1986 comedy movie The Money Pit, produced by Steven Spielberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raccoon

questions.question: Who was the first US President to have vetoed over 600 pieces of legislation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

questions.question: If x is positive, then x^2  x.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the first meal eaten on the moon?

options.text: Tang, rib roast, peas and carrots, and sugar cookies
Milk, eggs with cheese, and blueberries
Tang, chicken breast, and ice cream

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bacon, sugar cookies and peaches
